org.openadaptor.thirdparty.json
Class OrderedMapToJSONConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.AbstractConvertor
          org.openadaptor.thirdparty.json.OrderedMapToJSONConvertor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class OrderedMapToJSONConvertor
extends AbstractConvertor

Represent an OrderedMap as a JSON Object. Always converts an OrderedMap to a JSON Object. Makes no attempt to work out if a JSON Array would be more appropriate. Can be optionally configured to produce a JSON String rather than a JSONObject.

Author:
Kevin Scully

jsonObjectAsText

protected java.lang.String jsonObjectAsText(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)

jsonObjectFromOM

protected org.json.JSONObject jsonObjectFromOM(IOrderedMap record)
Convert an OrderedMap to a JSON Object. This method trawls through the OrderedMap looking for embedded OrderedMaps and Arrays and converting them to JSONObjects or JSONArrays. This means it won't cope with cycles very well.
The reason it recurses through the OrderedMap is that the Map constructor for JSONbject will not convert nested maps.
if asText is set thaen this convertor will produce a JSON String rather tham Objects or Arrays.

Parameters:
record - the OrderedMap to convert
Returns:
the equivalent JSONObject (or string)

jsonArrayFrom

protected org.json.JSONArray jsonArrayFrom(java.lang.Object[] array)
Convert an Array into a JSONArray. Iterate through the array and convert any IOrderedMaps or Arrays. If the array element being processed is itself an array then we add it as a nested element to the JSONArray.

Parameters:
array - arry of IOrderedMaps
Returns:
JSONArray
